sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः | यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ||1||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
bhūya eva mahā-bāho śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ
yat te ’haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣhyāmi hita-kāmyayā
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna. Because you are My dear friend, I shall speak to you further, giving knowledge that is better than what I have already explained.

sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः | अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ||2||
transliteration:
na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣhayaḥ
aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣhīṇāṁ cha sarvaśhaḥ
translation: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin, for in every way I am the source of the demigods and sages.

sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् | असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ||3||
transliteration:
yo mām ajam anādiṁ cha vetti loka-maheśhvaram
asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣhu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramuchyate
translation: He who knows Me as unborn and beginningless, as the Supreme Lord of all the worlds, is undeluded among mortals and is freed from all sins.

sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः | सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ||4||
transliteration:
buddhir jñānam asammohaḥ kṣhamā satyaṁ damaḥ śhamaḥ
sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo ’bhāvo bhayaṁ chābhayam eva cha
translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses and mind, happiness and distress, birth and death, fear and fearlessness...

sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः | भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ||5||
transliteration:
ahiṁsā samatā tuṣṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśho ’yaśhaḥ
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛithag-vidhāḥ
translation: ...nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy—all these various qualities of living beings arise from Me alone.

sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा | मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ||6||
transliteration:
maharṣhayaḥ sapta pūrve chatvāro manavas tathā
mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣhāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
translation: The seven great sages and the four Manus of ancient times were born from My mind, and from them all the people of the world have descended.

sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः | सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ||7||
transliteration:
etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ cha mama yo vetti tattvataḥ
so ’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra sanśhayaḥ
translation: One who truly understands My divine glories and yogic powers becomes united with Me through unwavering devotion. Of this there is no doubt.

sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते | इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ||8||
transliteration:
ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate
iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ
translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise, knowing this, worship Me with loving devotion.

sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् | कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ||9||
transliteration:
mach-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam
kathayantaśh cha māṁ nityaṁ tuṣhyanti cha ramanti cha
translation: With minds fixed on Me and lives surrendered to Me, My devotees enlighten one another and derive great satisfaction and bliss by speaking about Me.

sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् | ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ||10||
transliteration:
teṣhāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam
dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
translation: To those who are constantly devoted and worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.

sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः | नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ||11||
transliteration:
teṣhām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ
nāśhayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
translation: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् | पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ||12||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān
puruṣhaṁ śhāśhvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum
translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, the purest, the Absolute Truth. You are the eternal, divine person, the primal God, unborn and all-pervading.

sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा | असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ||13||
transliteration:
āhus tvām ṛiṣhayaḥ sarve devarṣhir nāradas tathā
asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ chaiva bravīṣhi me
translation: All the great sages such as Nārada, Asita, Devala, and Vyāsa confirm this truth about You, and now You Yourself are declaring it to me.

sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव | न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ||14||
transliteration:
sarvam etad ṛitaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśhava
na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ
translation: O Keshava, I accept as truth all that You have told me. Neither the gods nor the demons understand Your personality.

sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम | भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ||15||
transliteration:
svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣhottama
bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśha deva-deva jagat-pate
translation: Indeed, You alone know Yourself by Your own internal potency, O Supreme Person, origin of all, Lord of all beings, God of gods, Lord of the universe!

sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः | याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ||16||
transliteration:
vaktum arhasyaśheṣheṇa divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ
yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāns tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣhṭhasi
translation: Please tell me in detail of Your divine opulences by which You pervade all these worlds.

sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् | केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ||17||
transliteration:
kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogiṁs tvāṁ sadā parichintayan
keṣhu keṣhu cha bhāveṣhu chintyo ’si bhagavan mayā
translation: O Krishna, how shall I constantly think of You? In what forms should I meditate on You, O Supreme Lord?

sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन | भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ||18||
transliteration:
vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ cha janārdana
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛiptir hi śhṛiṇvato nāsti me ’mṛitam
translation: O Janardana, please describe again in detail Your divine powers and yogic opulences, for I never tire of hearing Your nectar-like words.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः | प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ||19||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
hanta te kathayiṣhyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ
prādhānyataḥ kuru-śhreṣhṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Yes, I will tell you of My divine manifestations, but only the most prominent ones, O best of the Kurus, for there is no end to My opulence.

sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः | अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ||20||
transliteration:
aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥ
aham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha
translation: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् | मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ||21||
transliteration:
ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir aṁśhumān
marīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī
translation: Among the Adityas I am Vishnu; among lights I am the radiant sun; among the Maruts I am Marichi; and among stars I am the moon.

sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः | इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ||22||
transliteration:
vedānāṁ sāma-vedo ’smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ
indriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā
translation: Among the Vedas I am the Sama Veda; among the gods I am Indra; among the senses I am the mind; and among living beings I am consciousness.

sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् | वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ||23||
transliteration:
rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasām
vasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham
translation: Among the Rudras I am Shankara; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas I am Kubera; among the Vasus I am Agni; and among mountains I am Meru.

sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् | सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ||24||
transliteration:
purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛihaspatim
senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
translation: Among priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati; among generals I am Skanda; among bodies of water I am the ocean.

sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् | यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ||25||
transliteration:
maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛigur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣharam
yajñānāṁ japa-yajño ’smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
translation: Among the great sages I am Bhrigu; among words I am the sacred syllable Om; among sacrifices I am the chanting of the holy names; and among immovable things I am the Himalayas.

sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः | गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ||26||
transliteration:
aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛikṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥ
gandharvāṇāṁ chitrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
translation: Among trees I am the sacred fig (Ashvattha), among divine sages I am Narada, among Gandharvas I am Chitraratha, and among perfected beings I am the sage Kapila.

sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् | ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ||27||
transliteration:
uchchaiḥśhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛitodbhavam
airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam
translation: Among horses know Me to be Ucchaihshravas, born of nectar; among elephants I am Airavata; and among men I am the king.

sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् | प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ||28||
transliteration:
āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
prajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
translation: Among weapons I am the thunderbolt; among cows I am the wish-fulfilling cow (Kamadhenu); I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and among serpents I am Vasuki.

sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् | पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ||29||
transliteration:
anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham
pitṝṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham
translation: Among serpents I am Ananta; among aquatic creatures I am Varuna; among ancestors I am Aryama; and among dispensers of law I am Yama, the lord of death.

sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् | मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ||30||
transliteration:
prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham
mṛigāṇāṁ cha mṛigendro ’haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām
translation: Among the Daityas I am Prahlada; among subduers I am time; among beasts I am the lion; and among birds I am Garuda.

sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् | झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ||31||
transliteration:
pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛitām aham
jhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
translation: Among purifiers I am the wind; among warriors I am Rama; among fish I am the shark; and among flowing rivers I am the Ganges.

sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन | अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ||32||
transliteration:
sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjuna
adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
translation: Of all creations I am the beginning, the end, and the middle, O Arjuna. Among sciences I am the science of the self, and among logicians I am the conclusive truth.

sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च | अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः ||33||
transliteration:
akṣharāṇām akāro ’smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya cha
aham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātā ’haṁ viśhvato-mukhaḥ
translation: Among letters I am the letter A; among compound words I am the dual word; I am also inexhaustible time; and I am the creator facing in all directions.

sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् | कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ||34||
transliteration:
mṛityuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatām
kīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛitir medhā dhṛitiḥ kṣhamā
translation: I am all-devouring death, and I am the origin of all that is yet to be. Among women I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and patience.

sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् | मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ||35||
transliteration:
bṛihat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām aham
māsānāṁ mārga-śhīrṣho ’ham ṛitūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
translation: Among the hymns of the Sama Veda I am the Brihat-Sama; of meters I am the Gayatri; among months I am Margashirsha; and among seasons I am spring, the season of flowers.

sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् | जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ||36||
transliteration:
dyūtaṁ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
jayo ’smi vyavasāyo ’smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham
translation: Among deceivers I am gambling; among the splendid I am splendor; I am victory, I am effort, and I am the quality of goodness in the virtuous.

sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः | मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ||37||
transliteration:
vṛiṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo ’smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ
munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ
translation: Of the Vrishni clan I am Vasudeva (Krishna); among the Pandavas I am Arjuna; among sages I am Vyasa; and among poets I am Ushana.

sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् | मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ||38||
transliteration:
daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatām
maunaṁ chaivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
translation: Among punishers I am the rod of chastisement; among those who seek victory I am morality; among secrets I am silence; and among the wise I am wisdom.

sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन | न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ||39||
transliteration:
yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna
na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam
translation: I am the seed of all living beings, O Arjuna. Nothing moving or non-moving can exist without Me.

sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतिनां परन्तप | एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ||40||
transliteration:
nānto ’sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnām parantapa
eṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
translation: O conqueror of enemies, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken is but a mere indication of My infinite opulences.

sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा | तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् ||41||
transliteration:
yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vā
tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṁ mama tejo-’nśha-sambhavam
translation: Know that all opulent, beautiful, and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor.

sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन | विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ||42||
transliteration:
athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna
viṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛitsnam ekāṁśhena sthito jagat
translation: But what need is there, O Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself I pervade and support this entire universe.
